title: Aiken Dojo
summary: Cardano's potential is locked behind complex setups and invisible logic. 60% of developers drop out because they spend days configuring environments instead of coding.
solution:
We are building the "Codecademy" of Cardano.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
1. Client-Side WASM Compilation (The Technical Breakthrough): Unlike existing playgrounds that rely on heavy backend servers (which are slow and costly to scale), Aiken Dojo ports the Aiken compiler to WebAssembly (WASM). This allows code to compile directly in the user's browser in milliseconds. It eliminates the "Nix/Docker" setup wall entirely—something no other Cardano education platform currently offers.



2. Visualizing the "Invisible" eUTxO: Current tools (like block explorers) display data as raw JSON or text, which is abstract for beginners. Aiken Dojo innovates by introducing a "UTXO Graph Renderer." We visually map inputs, outputs, and datum transformations as interactive nodes and edges. This turns the abstract eUTxO mental model into a tangible visual experience, drastically reducing the learning curve for developers coming from Ethereum (Account model).



3. "Gamified" vs "Academic": While current resources are excellent but academic (textbook style), Aiken Dojo applies the "Duolingo/Codecademy" model: bite-sized, interactive, and instantly rewarding with automated feedback loops.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
1. What the MVP will demonstrate:

- Instant Onboarding: A user will land on the website and compile a "Hello World" smart contract within 10 seconds, with zero software installation.
- Interactive Coding: A full Monaco-based editor (VS Code style) with custom Aiken syntax highlighting and error reporting.
- The "Feedback Loop": Users will complete the first module of exercises. The MVP will demonstrate the "Auto-Grader" system, which runs test cases against the user's code and provides immediate "Pass/Fail" feedback and visual debugging hints.

2. Where it can be accessed:

- Public URL: The MVP will be hosted at a public domain (e.g., aikendojo.io or a Vercel deployment link) accessible to anyone with a modern web browser.
- Open Source Repo: All source code (Frontend + WASM Adapter) will be published on GitHub under the MIT license for community verification.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
1. Educational Engagement (Platform Metrics):

- Completion Volume: Achieve 200+ completed coding exercises within the first 3 months of Mainnet launch.
- User Retention: Convert 15% of visitors who try the "Hello World" lesson into registered users who complete the "Validator Basics" module.

2. Technical Performance:

- Zero-Friction Speed: Maintain a compilation time of < 200ms via the WASM core to ensure a seamless flow.
- Reliability: Achieve 99.9% uptime for the learning environment.

3. Ecosystem Impact (On-Chain/Proxy Metrics):

- Testnet Transactions: Since this is a learning tool, we track success via the "Lucid Integration." We aim for students to generate 500+ successful transaction simulations (equivalent to Pre-Prod testnet txs) directly within the browser console, proving they have successfully built and signed a valid transaction.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
We are building the "Codecademy" of Cardano.

Aiken Dojo is a browser-native IDE that allows users to write, compile, and test Aiken smart contracts instantly. We remove the friction so developers can focus on logic, not infrastructure.

Zero-Setup Environment: Open the URL, and you are ready to code. No installs. No Nix. No waiting.

Visual Debugging:

Input: See the UTXOs your script is consuming.

Output: See the resulting UTXOs and Datum changes.

Gamified Curriculum: Progression from "Syntax Basics" to "Writing a Vesting Contract," verified by automated test runners in the browser.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
1. Democratizing Cardano Development: Currently, Cardano development is perceived as "elite" and "difficult." Aiken Dojo dismantles this perception. By removing the need for Nix/Docker setups, we lower the barrier to entry to near-zero. This directly increases the Top-of-Funnel developer acquisition, allowing anyone with a browser to write their first smart contract in seconds, not days.



2. Increasing Developer Retention & Success Rate: The "Haskell Gap" and abstract eUTxO model cause high drop-off rates. Our visual debugging tools and interactive curriculum directly address this "friction." By helping developers visualize inputs/outputs, we turn frustration into understanding. A developer who understands why their transaction failed is a developer who stays to build dApps.



3. Accelerating Cross-Chain Migration: Aiken Dojo acts as the perfect bridge for Solidity and TypeScript developers. By presenting a familiar IDE interface and C-family syntax (Aiken), we make Cardano accessible to the millions of Web2 and EVM developers, significantly expanding the talent pool available to build on Cardano.



4. Open Source Contribution: We are not just building a product; we are building infrastructure. Our core components (WASM compiler adapter, Monaco Editor integration, React components) will be open-sourced, allowing other education platforms and tool builders in the ecosystem to reuse our work.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
1. Team Expertise & Track Record: Our team combines deep expertise in Rust, WebAssembly (WASM), and Full-stack Web Development, which are the exact skills required for this project.

- Lead Engineer: Senior experience in Rust and system architecture, capable of handling the complex task of porting the Aiken compiler to WASM.
- Smart Contract Specialist: Deep understanding of the eUTxO model and Aiken best practices to design a curriculum that is both accurate and pedagogical.
- Frontend Lead: Expert in React/Next.js and data visualization (D3.js/Canvas), ensuring the "Visual Debugger" is intuitive and performant.
- 

2. Technical Feasibility & Validation:

- Proof of Concept: We have already validated that the Aiken compiler can be targeted to WASM. The core logic exists; the task is now integration and UI wrapper.
- Existing Standards: We are not reinventing the wheel. We leverage industry-standard tools (Monaco Editor for the IDE, Lucid for off-chain logic) to ensure stability and reduce development risk.



3. Project Management & Accountability:

- Agile Methodology: We operate on 2-week sprints with clear deliverables.
- Transparency: All code will be hosted on public GitHub repositories from Day 1. The community can track commits and progress in real-time.
- Milestone Reporting: We have broken down the project into 4 distinct milestones with verifiable outputs (e.g., "Compiler works," "First 10 lessons live") to ensure funds are released only upon proof of achievement.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
1. Software Development (65,000 ADA)

- Backend & Automation Developer: 20,000 ADA.
    - Role: Building the off-chain bot (Rust/Go) to monitor pool APYs, the data aggregation engine, and the "Copy-Trading" execution logic.

    - Role: Developing the React dashboard, the "Leaderboard" interface, and integrating Cardano wallets (Lace, Eternal).



2. Project Operations & Security (18,000 ADA)



- Internal Audit & Testing: 10,000 ADA.
    - Detail: Conducting extensive property-based testing (using Aiken's built-in tools), peer code reviews, and Pre-Prod testnet simulations.
- Infrastructure Costs: 8,000 ADA.
    - Detail: Cloud hosting (AWS/DigitalOcean), Database storage, and Blockfrost Enterprise API subscription for 12 months.

3. Marketing & Community (12,000 ADA)

- Content & Education: 7,000 ADA.
    - Detail: Production of "How-to" video tutorials, technical documentation for the open-source vaults, and project updates.
- Community Management: 5,000 ADA.
    - Detail: Managing the Discord server, support for Beta testers, and distributing incentives for early adopters.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
1. High ROI on Liquidity Retention: For a grant of just 95,000 ADA, CardanoFlow builds critical infrastructure to secure and grow millions in Total Value Locked (TVL). By automating rebalancing and preventing Impermanent Loss, we stop capital from leaving the ecosystem due to user frustration. If our tool saves just 10% of users from "rage-quitting" DeFi, the network fees generated from their continued activity will outweigh the cost of this proposal within the first year.



2. Closing the Gap with Competitors (at a fraction of the cost): Competitor chains like Solana and Arbitrum already offer automated "Smart Vaults" and copy-trading. This proposal brings Cardano to feature parity for < $40,000 USD (approx.). This is significantly cheaper than venture-backed alternatives on other chains, providing the ecosystem with a "pro-level" tool without the "pro-level" price tag.



3. The "Aiken" Efficiency Multiplier: By utilizing Aiken, we drastically reduce the development complexity and audit costs compared to legacy Plutus projects. This allows us to deliver a secure, production-ready DeFi protocol with a lean budget, allocating funds strictly to engineering logic rather than fighting tooling issues.



4. Sustainable "Public Good" Model: We are not building a tool that will require perpetual grants to survive. CardanoFlow is designed to become self-sustaining via a small performance fee on profitable copy-trades (e.g., 2% on profits). This Catalyst fund acts merely as the "seed capital" to build the engine; once launched, the protocol pays for its own maintenance and growth.



5. Open Source Contribution: The "Non-Custodial Smart Vault" pattern we are building is a reusable primitive. By open-sourcing this core logic, we save future developers hundreds of hours when building their own asset management or DAO treasury tools.
